metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4002 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
A memory leak flaw in the Linux kernel's hugetlbfs memory usage was foundin the way the user maps some regions of memory twice using shmget() whichare aligned to PUD alignment with the fault of some of the memory pages. Alocal user could use this flaw to get unauthorized access to some data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4002` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-189-generic - 3.13.0-189.240
linux-image-3.13.0-189-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-189.240
linux-image-3.13.0-189-lowlatency - 3.13.0-189.240
linux-image-3.13.0-189-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-189.240
linux-image-3.13.0-189-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-189.240
linux-image-3.13.0-189-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-189.240
linux-image-3.13.0-189-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-189.240
linux-image-3.13.0-189-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-189.240
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-189-generic - 3.13.0-189.240
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-189-lowlatency - 3.13.0-189.240
